Finding a Mate

The next day, Akir took their findings to trade them in for gold to someone he knew. Lately, Akir seemed to be working with some other thieves, though Blade wasn't ever sure. Blade wasn't ever allowed to go with him to these types of things, which left the feathered dragon alone in a gloomy state being without Akir. He'd either hang back and talk with Talia, the old dragoness, or go explore the market.

Akir returned home before too long with only one bag full of clinking, golden coins. Blade was happy to see that their previous night's venture paid off, but it seemed a little light for five-hundred gold pieces.

"That's it?” he asked, a little disappointed.

Akir chuckled and set the bag down, the bottom of it expanding outward. "I already bought our new home. This is what's left over!”

Blade squeaked happily and pawed at some of the coins inside the bag. "R- Really?”

"Actually, it's not,” Akir teased.

Blade's ears sadly drooped. "Oh... Why di—”

Then Akir plucked another hefty bag from his satchel and plopped it on the table, interrupting Blade as he exclaimed, "This is what's left!”

Blade's golden eyes bulged as yet another large bag nearly spilled its contents. "H- How did you get so much?”

Akir nuzzled Blade firmly and gave him an affectionate lick along his cheek. "We had three bags with two-hundred and fifty coins in each, and I spent the first on our house. There was another special gem you happened to find in that jewelry you picked up, so we got another bag out of it!”

Blade bared his teeth in a joyful grin as he nearly bounced up and down. "Really!?” He felt a sense of pride, having accomplished something useful for once. And it seemed to have made Akir very happy too, which made Blade even happier!

Akir laughed and nodded before sliding one of the bags to Blade. "You keep one bag, and I'll keep the other.”

Blade nodded and clutched it in his paws. It was heavy! "Th- Thanks, Akir...”

Akir nuzzled his snout. "Don't thank me, Blade. We both took a risk there, and we both had a part.”

A warmth rose in Blade's chest as his eyes met Akir's soft, deep-blue spheres. He felt something there, a deep-rooted love that his older-brother seldom showed him. Blade could only nod with a huge smile spreading his cheeks.

"So, you're finally leaving? I thought I'd croak before you two would leave,” Talia said as she walked into the room. She leaned against the wall with her arms crossed. A small grin curled her lips.

Blade nodded and showed her his bag of gold coins. "Look what we got!”

She chuckled. "I can only assume how you acquired that much gold.”

"We stole a necklace fr—”

"No, don't tell me!” she interrupted and waved him off. "I don't want to be accountable if someone comes looking for you two!”

Blade meeped and giggled. "Sorry... You think people know we've been here?”

"Well, of course. It's not like you two are hiding it or anything, and I'm sure people have noticed two ferals constantly around here.”

"I hope it doesn't bring you any trouble,” Akir said. "I really appreciate what you've done for me and Blade.”

Blade was surprised to hear that from Akir, and Talia seemed even more surprised!

"You're uhm... you're welcome. It's been nice having you two around... Make sure you come and visit!”

"We will!” Blade replied and nodded.

Akir reached into his sack and pulled out a large pawful of golden coins. Some of them spilled from his grasp, but he didn't bother picking them up. He let the coins slide onto the table in a decently sized pile.

"This is for everything you've done for us,” Akir said. "Thank you.”

The sincerity in Akir's voice shocked Blade again. He did the same and put his pile on top of Akir's. "And this is for fixing me!”

Talia unfolded her arms and took on an expression of genuine gratitude as she walked up to them. "You guys... That's... so very kind of you.”

Blade smiled softly and wrapped a wing around her. "We wouldn't have made all of this money if it weren't for you,” he said truthfully. "You deserve it more than us.” He nuzzled her warmly as she hugged him. Blade heard her sniffle and grinned.

When she pulled away, she wiped her eyes. Blade had never seen her tear up before, and it warmed his heart to know that she was that happy.

"Get out of here before I call the guards,” she teased.

Blade and Akir chuckled and stored their bags in their satchels. "Bye, Talia! See you soon!”

She waved at them as they closed the door behind them.

After that, they left for their new home on the other side of the feral district.

Like most of the homes around, it was just a stone hovel that provided an ample amount of shelter. It was roomy inside too, a perfect size for both Akir and Blade. There were a total of two rooms inside, one being very large, having all they needed to live, and then the other being smaller and serving as a bedroom. Compared to where they had lived before, this was a dream come true!

Blade eagerly trotted around, inspecting every nook and cranny of the stone-carved wall. There wasn't any furniture in it yet, so it felt rather barren, but that was something they could work for! They agreed to only spend some of their earnings on the things they needed first. Then after that, they could figure out more what they wanted. They wanted the money to last them as long as possible, so they couldn't spend it freely. Thankfully, they were used to not having money. The money they had now was more than what they had collected over the course of their lives!

Blade and Akir were much happier after that. Instead of scrounging around for or stealing food all day, they could relax.
